oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews George Jones Parts 4 and 5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of George Jones (performer) for Nashville's WSM. Tape labeled parts 4 and 5. Recording is from an unknown date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; George Jones
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:06) Ralph Emery greets the crowd and introduces Hank Williams Jr. "All My Rowdy Friends Are Coming Over Tonight" -- (00:24) Ralph Emery introduces George Jones and has Jones discuss the ways in which country music has changed over time -- (03:25) Emery inquires about Jones' opinion about 'pop-music' -- (06:03) Emery and Jones reflect on the lyrics behind "White Lightning" -- (07:54) Emery and Jones discuss the single Christmas record that Jones had recorded -- (08:46) Jones characterizes his family's on-going exploits and his desires for Christmas -- (11:32) Emery inquires about Jones' upcoming schedule (including a cruise) -- (13:12) Emery has Jones construe his time working at a station in Beaumont, Texas -- (15:19) Emery performs his commercial outros, and Emery says goodbye to the audience -- (15:52) Emery greets the crowd, and Emery and Jones introduce the Charley Pride record -- (16:27) Emery invites Jones to discuss a pair of books about Jones' life that he disagrees with the information presented -- (20:37) Emery inquires the work Jones did with Gene Pitney -- (23:21) Emery expresses his concern for Jones' health -- (24:15) Emery discusses Hank Williams' influence with Jones -- (29:03) Emery and Jones express their appreciation for each other, and Emery shows his desire to see Jones as a member of the Country Music Hall of Fame -- (30:28) Emery says his goodbye to the audience and performs his commercial outros
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Jones, George; Jones, George, 1931-2013;
